doc/Input_Files.md

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 Input Files
00002 ===========
00003 
00004 The following input files are required to run HyPar. They are indicated as being mandatory or 
00005 optional. If optional, then default values are used if not found.
00006 
00007 \b Note: It is best to start with the provided examples, understand their input files based on the 
00008 information on this page, and then modify them to run other cases.
00009 
00010 \section solver_inp solver.inp
00011 
00012 Requirement: \b mandatory
00013 
00014 Read by: ReadInputs()
00015 
00016 Description: Specify the main simulation-related parameters.
00017 
00018 Format: ASCII text
00019 
00020         begin
00021             <keyword>   <value>
00022             <keyword>   <value>
00023             <keyword>   <value>
00024             ...
00025             <keyword>   <value>
00026         end
00027 
00028 where the list of keywords and their type are:\n
00029 Keyword name       | Type         | Variable                      | Default value
00030 ------------------ | ------------ | ----------------------------- | ------------------------
00031 ndims              | int          | #HyPar::ndims                 | 1
00032 nvars              | int          | #HyPar::nvars                 | 1
00033 size               | int[ndims]   | #HyPar::dim_global            | must be specified
00034 iproc              | int[ndims]   | #MPIVariables::iproc          | must be specified
00035 ghost              | int          | #HyPar::ghosts                | 1
00036 n_iter             | int          | #HyPar::n_iter                | 0
00037 restart_iter       | int          | #HyPar::restart_iter          | 0
00038 time_scheme        | char[]       | #HyPar::time_scheme           | euler
00039 time_scheme_type   | char[]       | #HyPar::time_scheme_type      | none
00040 hyp_space_scheme   | char[]       | #HyPar::spatial_scheme_hyp    | 1
00041 hyp_flux_split     | char[]       | #HyPar::SplitHyperbolicFlux   | no
00042 hyp_interp_type    | char[]       | #HyPar::interp_type           | characteristic
00043 par_space_type     | char[]       | #HyPar::spatial_type_par      | nonconservative-1stage
00044 par_space_scheme   | char[]       | #HyPar::spatial_scheme_par    | 2
00045 dt                 | double       | #HyPar::dt                    | 0.0
00046 conservation_check | char[]       | #HyPar::ConservationCheck     | no
00047 screen_op_iter     | int          | #HyPar::screen_op_iter        | 1
00048 file_op_iter       | int          | #HyPar::file_op_iter          | 1000
00049 op_file_format     | char[]       | #HyPar::op_file_format        | text
00050 ip_file_type       | char[]       | #HyPar::ip_file_type          | ascii
00051 input_mode         | char[]       | #HyPar::input_mode            | serial
00052 output_mode        | char[]       | #HyPar::output_mode           | serial
00053 op_overwrite       | char[]       | #HyPar::op_overwrite          | no
00054 model              | char[]       | #HyPar::model                 | must be specified
00055 immersed_body      | char[]       | #HyPar::ib_filename           | "none"
00056 
00057 \b Notes:
00058 + "ndims" \b must be specified \b before "size" and "iproc".
00059 + if "input_mode" or "output_mode" are set to "parallel" or "mpi-io",
00060   the number of I/O ranks must be specified right after as an integer.
00061   For example:
00062 
00063       begin
00064           ...
00065           input_mode  parallel 4
00066           ...
00067       end
00068 
00069   This means that 4 MPI ranks will participate in file I/O (assuming
00070   total MPI ranks is more than 4) (see ReadArrayParallel(), 
00071   WriteArrayParallel(), ReadArrayMPI_IO() ).
00072   - The number of I/O ranks specified for "input_mode" and "output_mode"
00073     \b must \b be \b same. Otherwise, the value for the one specified last
00074     will be used.
00075   - The number of I/O ranks must be such that the total number of MPI ranks
00076     is an integer multiple. Otherwise, the code will use only 1 I/O rank.
00077 + If any of the keywords are not present, the default value is used, except
00078   the ones whose default values say "must be specified". Thus, keywords that
00079   are not required for a particular simulation may be left out of the 
00080   solver.inp input file. For example, 
00081   - a #Euler1D simulation does not need "par_space_type" or "par_space_scheme"
00082     because it does not have a parabolic term.
00083   - unless a conservation check is required, "conservation_check" can be left
00084     out and the code will not check for conservation.
00085   - "immersed_body" need not be specified if there are no immersed bodies present.
00086     \b NOTE: However, if it is specified, and a file of that filename does not
00087     exist, it will result in an error.
00088 
00089 \section boundary_inp boundary.inp
00090 
00091 Requirement: \b mandatory
00092 
00093 Read by: InitializeBoundaries()
00094 
00095 Description: Specify boundary conditions.
00096 
00097 Format: ASCII text
00098         
00099         nb
00100         boundary_type   spatial_dimension   face   [extent] 
00101         boundary_type   spatial_dimension   face   [extent] 
00102         ...
00103         boundary_type   spatial_dimension   face   [extent] 
00104 
00105 where
00106 + \b nb is the number of boundaries
00107 + This is followed by at least \b nb rows, each row specifying:
00108   - \b boundary_type - Type of boundary, eg. #_PERIODIC_, #_EXTRAPOLATE_, #_DIRICHLET_, etc. See include/boundaryconditions.h for a full list.
00109   - \b spatial_dimension - The spatial dimension along which this boundary condition applies. Must be in the range 0, 1, ..., #HyPar::ndims-1
00110   - \b face - The face on which this the boundary acts (1 means the left face along the dimension, or the low index end, -1 means the right face
00111               along the dimension, or the high index end).
00112   - [\b extent] - The extent of this boundary (in terms of coordinates, not grid indices). Written as (2 X #HyPar::ndims) real numbers:
00113                   xmin_0  xmax_0  xmin_1  xmax_1 ... ... xmin_(ndims-1)  xmax_(ndims-1), where [xmin_i, xmax_i] define the extent along
00114                   spatial dimension i. Note that the xmin_i and xmax_i for i = spatial_dimension are ignored, but should be there for the
00115                   sake of a uniform format (they can be set as 0).
00116 + For the following boundary types, an additional line is required right below the line specifying that boundary with inputs specific to that 
00117   boundary type:
00118   - #_DIRICHLET_: the next line should specify the boundary value of the solution at that boundary (the value is assumed to be constant in space
00119     and time). Each component of the solution must be specified (i.e. #HyPar::nvars real numbers).
00120 
00121         u[0]  u[1]  ... u[#HyPar::nvars-1]
00122 
00123   - #_SLIP_WALL_, #_NOSLIP_WALL_, #_SW_SLIP_WALL_, or #_SW_NOSLIP_WALL_: the next line should specify the wall velocity (assumed to be constant 
00124     in space and time). Each component of the velocity must be specified (i.e. #HyPar::ndims real numbers).
00125 
00126         u[0]  u[1]  ... u[#HyPar::ndims-1]
00127 
00128   - #_SUBSONIC_INFLOW_: the next line must specify the inflow density and velocity vector (assumed to be constant in space and time). Each component
00129     of the velocity must be specified (i.e. #HyPar::ndims+1 real numbers)
00130 
00131         rho  u[0]  u[1]  ... u[#HyPar::ndims-1]
00132 
00133   - #_SUBSONIC_OUTFLOW_: the next line must specify the outflow pressure (assumed to be constant in space and time), i.e., one real number
00134 
00135         p
00136 
00137   - #_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_: the next line must specify the inflow density, velocity, and pressure (assumed to be constant in space and time). Each component
00138     of the velocity must be specified (i.e. #HyPar::ndims+2 real numbers)
00139 
00140         rho  u[0]  u[1]  ... u[#HyPar::ndims-1]  p
00141 
00142     Note that this boundary can also be implemented through the #_DIRICHLET_; however, the flow variables must be converted to the conserved variable
00143     form to specify the Dirichlet boundary value:
00144 
00145         rho  rho*u[0]  rho*u[1]  ... rho*u[#HyPar::ndims-1]  E (internal energy)
00146 
00147   - #_TURBULENT_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_: the next line must specify the inflow mean density, velocity, and pressure (assumed to be constant in space and time),
00148     i.e, #HyPar::ndims+2 real numbersm and the name of the file that contains the unsteady fluctuation data.
00149 
00150         rho  u[0]  u[1]  ... u[#HyPar::ndims-1]  p  filename
00151 
00152 
00153 \section initial_inp initial.inp
00154 
00155 Requirement: \b mandatory
00156 
00157 Read by: InitialSolution(), through ReadArray()
00158 
00159 Format: Depends on #HyPar::input_mode and #HyPar::ip_file_type, specified in \b solver.inp. See ReadArraySerial(), ReadArrayParallel(), and 
00160         ReadArrayMPI_IO() to understand the format and data layout of this file.
00161 
00162 Description: This file contains the initial solution. It will probably not be created by hand. See the examples provided for codes that generate
00163              this file for various problems. The final part in these codes, where the initial solution is written to file, can be reused to 
00164              generate this file for a new case.
00165 
00166 \section lusolver_inp lusolver.inp
00167 
00168 Requirement: \b optional
00169 
00170 Read by: tridiagLUInit()
00171 
00172 Description: Specify parameters related to LU solvers for tridiagonal systems of equations. This file is relevant only if
00173              some method requiring the solution of a tridiagonal system of equations is being used (for example:
00174              Interp1PrimFifthOrderCRWENO() ).
00175 
00176 Format: ASCII text
00177         
00178         begin
00179             <keyword>   <value>
00180             <keyword>   <value>
00181             <keyword>   <value>
00182             ...
00183             <keyword>   <value>
00184         end
00185 
00186 where the list of keywords are:
00187 
00188 Keyword name       | Type         | Variable                      | Default value
00189 ------------------ | ------------ | ----------------------------- | ------------------------
00190 evaluate_norm      | int          | #TridiagLU::evaluate_norm     | 1
00191 maxiter            | int          | #TridiagLU::maxiter           | 10
00192 atol               | double       | #TridiagLU::atol              | 1e-12
00193 rtol               | double       | #TridiagLU::rtol              | 1e-10
00194 verbose            | int          | #TridiagLU::verbose           | 0
00195 reducedsolvetype   | char[]       | #TridiagLU::reducedsolvetype  | #_TRIDIAG_JACOBI_
00196 
00197 
00198 \section weno_inp weno.inp
00199 
00200 Requirement: \b optional
00201 
00202 Read by: WENOInitialize() 
00203 
00204 Description: Specify parameters related to WENO-type spatial discretization. This file is relevant only if a WENO-type 
00205              method is being used for spatial discretization (for example: Interp1PrimFifthOrderCRWENO(), Interp1PrimFifthOrderWENO(),
00206              Interp1PrimFifthOrderHCWENO() ). For most cases, this file is useful if a very specific study on the behavior of the
00207              WENO-type method is being carried out; typically, the default values are enough to ensure "good" solutions.
00208 
00209 Format: ASCII text
00210         
00211         begin
00212             <keyword>   <value>
00213             <keyword>   <value>
00214             ...
00215             <keyword>   <value>
00216         end
00217 
00218 where the list of keywords are:
00219 
00220 Keyword name       | Type         | Variable                      | Default value
00221 ------------------ | ------------ | ----------------------------- | ------------------------
00222 mapped             | int          | #WENOParameters::mapped       | 0
00223 borges             | int          | #WENOParameters::borges       | 0
00224 yc                 | int          | #WENOParameters::yc           | 0
00225 no_limiting        | int          | #WENOParameters::no_limiting  | 0
00226 epsilon            | double       | #WENOParameters::eps          | 1e-6
00227 rc                 | double       | #WENOParameters::rc           | 0.3
00228 xi                 | double       | #WENOParameters::xi           | 0.001
00229 tol                | double       | #WENOParameters::tol          | 1e-16
00230 
00231 \section physics_inp physics.inp
00232 
00233 Requirement: \b mandatory/optional (depends on the physical model)
00234 
00235 Read by: The initialization function of the various physics modules (eg. Euler1DInitialize(), NavierStokes2DInitialize(), etc)
00236 
00237 Description: This file contains inputs specific to a physics model. Depending on the physical model being used, it may or may not
00238              be mandatory. The exact parameters to specify depend on the physics.
00239 
00240 Format: ASCII text
00241         
00242         begin
00243             <keyword>   <value>
00244             <keyword>   <value>
00245             ...
00246             <keyword>   <value>
00247         end
00248 
00249 See the documentation for the initialization function of the various phyical models for a list of keywords (for example, Euler1DInitialize(), NavierStokes2DInitialize()).
00250 
00251 \section petscrc .petscrc
00252 
00253 Requirement: \b mandatory <B>if using PETSc time integration</B>; if absent, HyPar will use native time integration. 
00254              If compiled without PETSc, this file is not required.
00255 
00256 Read by: PETSc
00257 
00258 Description: This file contains the input flags required by PETSc time integration and its associated features.
00259 
00260 Format: ASCII text
00261 
00262 \b Note: The contents of this file may also be specified as command line flags.
00263 
00264 This file contains all the inputs required for the PETSc time integrators. See PETSc documentation (http://www.mcs.anl.gov/petsc/documentation/)
00265 for all the inputs that PETSc needs, or <B>see the PETSc examples</B> for the inputs relevant to HyPar. In addition, following 
00266 are the HyPar-specific inputs (they are all optional, if not specified, default values are used):
00267 + <B>-use-petscts</B>: If this flag is specified, PETSc time integration is used. If not specified, native time integration is used 
00268   (default).
00269 + <B>-jfnk_epsilon \<value\></B>: specify \f$\epsilon\f$ parameter for the directional-derivative-based approximation of the Jacobian 
00270   (relevant only for implicit and IMEX time integration) (default: \f$10^{-6}\f$).
00271 + <B>-with_pc</B>: If this flag is specified, a preconditioning matrix will be assembled for use with the preconditioners available
00272   in PETSc. If not specified, no preconditioning will be used (default).
00273 
00274 In addition, if an IMEX time integrator (TSARKIMEX - http://www.mcs.anl.gov/petsc/petsc-current/docs/manualpages/TS/TSARKIMEX.html) 
00275 is being used, the following terms specify how the hyperbolic, parabolic,
00276 and source terms are integrated in time (explicitly or implicitly):
00277 + <B>-hyperbolic_explicit</B>: treat hyperbolic term explicitly (\b default).
00278 + <B>-parabolic_explicit</B>: treat parabolic term explicitly.
00279 + <B>-source_explicit</B>: treat the source term explicitly.
00280 + <B>-hyperbolic_implicit</B>: treat hyperbolic term implicitly.
00281 + <B>-parabolic_implicit</B>: treat parabolic term implicitly (\b default).
00282 + <B>-source_implicit</B>: treat the source term implicitly (\b default).
00283 
00284 \section immersed_body Immersed Body
00285 
00286 Requirement: \b mandatory <B>if using immersed boundaries</B> (the keyword \a immersed_body is specified in 
00287              \b solver.inp); if absent, HyPar will not use immersed boundaries.
00288 
00289 Read by: IBReadBodySTL(), called by the initialization function for immersed boundaries InitializeImmersedBoundaries().
00290 
00291 File name: The name of this file <B>must</B> be the same as the value of the keyword \a immersed_body in \b solver.inp.
00292 
00293 Format: ASCII STL (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/STL_%28file_format%29)
00294 
00295 Notes:
00296 + The normal defined in the STL file must be the <B>"outward"</B> normal, i.e., pointing outside the body.
00297 + The geometry must be a closed one.
00298 + Some sample STL files are available in \b hypar/Examples/STLGeometries/
